clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Approval Clinical Trial Comparing the Long Term Safety and Effectiveness Coflex vs. Fusion to Treat Lumbar Spinal Stenosis
clinical_study.official_title: Post-Approval Study to Investigate The Long Term (5-Year) Survivorship of Coflex Compared to Control Fusion Study Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Post-Approval Clinical Study Comparing the Long Term Safety and Effectiveness of coflex vs. Fusion to Treat Lumbar Spinal Stenosis

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this post-approval study is to examine the long-term survivorship of the coflex®. The coflex® Interlaminar Technology is an interlaminar stabilization device indicated for use in one or two level lumbar stenosis from L1-L5 in skeletally mature patients with at least moderate impairment in function, who experience relief in flexion from their symptoms of leg/buttocks/groin pain, with or without back pain, and who have undergone at least 6 months of non-operative treatment. The coflex® is intended to be implanted midline between adjacent lamina of 1 or 2 contiguous lumbar motion segments. Interlaminar stabilization is performed after decompression of stenosis at the affected level(s).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Improvement of at Least 15 Points in ODI
primary_outcome.description: The primary variable of performance is the assessment of Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability Index (ODI) in both treatment groups at 5 years. It will be assessed if the improvement in ODI since the pre surgery status in the coflex™ group is better than the improvement in the control group (scale 0-100 with a higher score representing increased disability).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Reoperations, Revisions, Removals, or Supplemental Fixation
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of secondary surgical interventions, i.e., reoperations, revisions, removals, or supplemental fixation associated with either coflex or control group. Refer to FDA guidance for complete definitions (https://www.fda.gov/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm072263.htm).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Major Device Related Complications
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of major device-related complications at 5 years

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Epidural Injection(s)
Number of Subjects With no Persistent New or Increasing Sensory or Motor Deficit
primary_outcome.description: No persistent new or increasing sensory or motor deficit

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Persistent New or Increasing Sensory Deficit
primary_outcome.description: No persistent new or increasing sensory deficit

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Persistent New or Increasing Motor Deficit
primary_outcome.description: No persistent new or increasing motor deficit

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With no Reoperations or Epidural (Up to Day 1825)
primary_outcome.description: No reoperations, revisions, removals or supplemental fixation and no epidural injection at any lumbar level up to and including the Month 60 visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Decrease in Zurich Claudication Questionnaire (ZCQ) Symptom Severity of at Least 0.5 Points
secondary_outcome.description: ZCQ is a scale that measures physical function, symptom severity, and patient satisfaction for patients with spinal stenosis. Scores range from 1-5 with a higher score indicating worsening disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Decrease in Zurich Claudication Questionnaire (ZCQ) Physical Function of at Least 0.5 Points
secondary_outcome.description: ZCQ is a scale that measures physical function, symptom severity, and patient satisfaction for patients with spinal stenosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Maintenance or Improvement in SF-12 Physical Function Component
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the patient's Quality of Life as measured by SF-12. Scores range from 0 to 100, where a zero score indicates the lowest level of health. Success was defined as subjects who maintained or improved from their SF-12 score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Maintenance or Improvement in SF-12 Mental Health Component
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the patient's Quality of Life as measured by SF-12. Scores range from 0 to 100, where a zero score indicates the lowest level of health. Success was defined as subjects who maintained or improved from their SF-12 score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Decrease in VAS Back Pain of at Least 20mm
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for low back pain (on the 100 mm scale) compared to control group. On a scale of 0 to 100, 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Decrease VAS Worse Leg Pain of at Least 20mm
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for leg pain (on the 100 mm scale) compared to control group. On a scale of 0 to 100, 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of disability from low back pain as measured by ODI (Oswestry Disability Index) mean score in each treatment group at 5 years. On a scale of 0-100, a higher score represents increased disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Analog Scale Back Pain Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Back Pain as measured by VAS mean score in each treatment group at 5 years. On a scale of 0-100mm, a higher score represents worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Analog Scale Leg (Worse) Pain Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Worse Leg Pain by VAS mean score in each treatment group at 5 years. On a scale of 0-100mm, a higher score represents worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Leg (Right) Pain Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Right Leg Pain by VAS mean score in each treatment group at 5 years. On a scale of 0-100mm, a higher score represents worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Leg (Left) Pain Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Left Leg Pain by VAS mean score in both treatment groups at 5 years. On a scale of 0-100mm, a higher score represents worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Decrease in VAS Right Leg Pain of at Least 20mm
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for low back pain (on the 100 mm scale) compared to control group. On a scale of 0 to 100, 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Decrease in VAS Left Leg Pain of at Least 20mm
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for low back pain (on the 100 mm scale) compared to control group. On a scale of 0 to 100, 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst pain imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Zurich Claudication Questionnaire (ZCQ) Symptom Severity Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of symptom severity by ZCQ mean score in both treatment groups at 5 years. ZCQ is a scale that measures physical function, symptom severity, and patient satisfaction for patients with spinal stenosis. Scores range from 1-5 with a higher score indicating worsening disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Zurich Claudication Questionnaire (ZCQ) Physical Function Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of physical function by ZCQ mean score in both groups at 5 years. ZCQ is a scale that measures physical function, symptom severity, and patient satisfaction for patients with spinal stenosis. Scores range from 1-5 with a higher score indicating worsening disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Short Form-12 Physical Component Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the patient's Quality of Life as measured by SF-12 mean score in both treatment groups at 5 years. Scores range from 0 to 100, where a zero score indicates the lowest level of health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Short Form-12 Mental Component Score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the patient's Quality of Life as measured by SF-12 mean score in both treatment groups at 5 years. Scores range from 0 to 100, where a zero score indicates the lowest level of health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Survey: Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who responded "Very Satisfied" or "Somewhat Satisfied".

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Survey: Recommendation of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects who responded "Definitely Yes" or "Probably Yes"

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management: Class II Narcotics Usage by Device Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects using Class II narcotics

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management: NSAIDs/ASA/Acetaminophen Usage by Device Group
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects using NSAIDs/ASA/Acetaminophen

other_outcome.measure: Mean Rotation (F to E) in Degrees - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of rotation (flexion to extension) at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Rotation (F to E) in Degrees - Below Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of rotation (flexion to extension) at the level below the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Rotation (F to E) in Degrees - Above Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of rotation (flexion to extension) at the level above the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of translation at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (mm) - Below Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of translation at the level below the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (mm) - Above Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of translation at the level above the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Anterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of anterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Posterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of posterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (F to E) in Percent (%) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the percentage of translation at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (F to E) in Percent (%) - Below Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the percentage of translation at the level below the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Translation (F to E) in Percent (%) - Above Level of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the percentage of translation at the level above the implant in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Average Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average measure of disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Anterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from baseline for anterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Posterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from baseline for posterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Average Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from baseline for disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Anterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from immediate post-op for anterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Posterior Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from immediate post-op for posterior disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Average Disc Height (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the average change from immediate post-op for disc height at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Disc Angle in Degrees - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the mean disc angle at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Disc Angle in Degrees - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the mean change in disc angle from baseline at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Disc Angle in Degrees - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the mean change in disc angle from immediate post-op at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Spondylolisthesis (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the measure of spondylolisthesis at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Spondylolisthesis (%) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the measure of the percentage of spondylolisthesis at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Spondylolisthesis (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the mean change in measure of spondylolisthesis at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Spondylolisthesis (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: As determined by independent radiographic lab, this is the mean change in measure of spondylolisthesis from immediate post-op at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Foraminal Height (X-ray) (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: This is the mean foraminal height via x-ray at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-Op Foraminal Height (X-ray) (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: This is the mean change in foraminal height via x-ray from baseline at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Post-Op Foraminal Height (X-ray) (mm) - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: This is the mean change in foraminal height via x-ray from immediate post-op at the index level(s) in both treatment groups at 5 years.

other_outcome.measure: Bony Bridging
other_outcome.description: Bridging through the posterolateral gutters, between the facet joints, between transverse processes, and/or between facet joint and transverse process will all be considered acceptable forms of bridging bone.

other_outcome.measure: Heterotopic Ossification
other_outcome.description: Assessment applicable to coflex arm only. The assessment applies to bony formations that occur in and around the implant.

other_outcome.measure: Fusion Status
other_outcome.description: The assessment is an analysis of three component factors: Bridging Bone, Angular Motion and Translational Motion.

other_outcome.measure: Interface Remodeling - At Level(s) of Implant
other_outcome.description: Per level; Assessment applicable to coflex arm only. This is an assessment of the bone-implant interface.

other_outcome.measure: Device Condition (Coflex Arm)
other_outcome.description: Per level; Assessment only applicable to coflex group. Device Condition in the investigational subjects was graded as: Intact, Deformed, Fractured, Migrated, or Dislodged.

other_outcome.measure: Device Condition (Fusion Control)
other_outcome.description: Per level; This assessment is applicable to the fusion arm only. Device Condition in the control subjects will be graded as: Intact, Loose Screws, or Failed Hardware.

other_outcome.measure: Device Mobility
other_outcome.description: Per level; Assessment is applicable to coflex arm only. Device Mobility is an expected occurrence in some subjects and represents the amount of the of lift-off of the implant from the inferior spinous process.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Maintenance or Improvement in SF-12 Mental Health Component
measure.description: Assessment of the patient's Quality of Life as measured by SF-12. Scores range from 0 to 100, where a zero score indicates the lowest level of health. Success was defined as subjects who maintained or improved from their SF-12 score at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Decrease in VAS Back Pain of at Least 20mm
outcome.description: Improvement of the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for low back pain (on the 100 mm scale) compared to control group. On a scale of 0 to 100, 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates worst pain imaginable.

outcome.title: Mean Zurich Claudication Questionnaire (ZCQ) Symptom Severity Score
outcome.description: Assessment of symptom severity by ZCQ mean score in both treatment groups at 5 years. ZCQ is a scale that measures physical function, symptom severity, and patient satisfaction for patients with spinal stenosis. Scores range from 1-5 with a higher score indicating worsening disability.
